title: Canyonlands National Park: Entrada Sandstone
body: Entrada Formation        The Entrada Formation in Arches National Park NPS/Herbert       This layer does not occur in Canyonlands, but is dramatically visible throughout Arches National Park. Deposited: Mid to late Jurassic (144 to 208 million years ago) Depositional Environment: Windblown sand dunes Appearance: Red, cross-bedded, arch-forming sandstone  Example: Monitor and Merrimac buttes along Highway 313 to the Island in the Sky         Rock Strata   Layer Above: Curtis Formation   Current Layer: Entrada Sandstone   Layer Below: Carmel Formation
